body_content.explanation: an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) that is often grown in hedges (= lines of small trees planted very close together, especially along the edge of a garden, field, or road):
examples: The hedge of arborvitae has never been pruned.
The beautifully tended grounds were lined with arborvitaes, which created a sense of privacy.
Since arborvitae are evergreen, birds and small mammals find shelter in their dense branches all year round.
